summary: This document is an interview with Jeffrey Epstein discussing his involvement in political activities and national security issues, particularly in relation to the 2004 presidential election and the upcoming symposium organized by The People's Truth Forum. Epstein emphasizes the threat of radical Islam and the need for public awareness and action against terrorism.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein discusses his background, political involvement, and efforts to raise awareness about national security threats.

persons.name: Larry Bailey
persons.role: President of Vietnam Vets for Truth
persons.context: Epstein mentions his affiliation with Bailey and the organization during the 2004 campaign.

persons.name: Harvey Kushner
persons.context: Kushner is mentioned as a speaker at the symposium organized by The People's Truth Forum.

persons.name: Brigitte Gabriel
persons.context: Gabriel is mentioned as a speaker at the symposium, providing her firsthand account of Islamic Jihad.

persons.name: Robert Spencer
persons.context: Spencer is mentioned as a speaker at the symposium and is noted for his writings on Islam.

persons.name: Laura Mansfield
persons.context: Mansfield is mentioned as a speaker at the symposium, using her expertise to investigate jihad.

persons.name: Bernie Kerik
persons.role: Former Police Commissioner of New York City
persons.context: Kerik is mentioned as endorsing the symposium and planning to attend.

persons.name: Tom Tancredo
persons.context: Tancredo is mentioned as endorsing the symposium and planning to attend.

persons.name: Judson Cox
persons.context: Cox is mentioned as the editor of the publication that conducted the interview.

events.title: The Radical Islamist Threat to World Peace and National Security Symposium
events.description: A symposium organized by The People's Truth Forum to educate attendees about the threat of radical Islam.

keyFacts: Epstein discusses his previous political involvement and the role he played in the 2004 presidential election.
The People's Truth Forum is organizing a symposium to address the threat of radical Islam.
Several notable speakers are scheduled to participate in the symposium, including experts on terrorism.
Bernie Kerik and Tom Tancredo have endorsed the symposium and plan to attend.
The document reflects Epstein's views on national security and the perceived threats from radical Islam.
